title: Pilot
description: Hank Hill is a proud and true American. He loves his job as a propane salesman, and respects and loves his family. But one day, after his son Bobby receives a black eye from a baseball game and Hank is heard raising his voice at the Mega-lo Mart, some women come to suspect Hank abuses his son. Word of mouth gets around and soon Hank finds himself under investigation by a skinny, neurotic social worker.

title: Square Peg
description: Peggy is chosen to be the Sex Education teacher at Bobby's school.

title: The Order of the Straight Arrow
description: When Bobby becomes a member of the Straight Arrows, Hank, Dale, Bill, & Boomhauer volunteer to take them on a camping trip. While there Bobby accidentally kill a whooping crane.

title: Hank's Got the Willies
description: Bobby accidentally hits Hank's hero, Willie Nelson, with a golf ball.

title: Luanne's Saga
description: After Buckley dumps Luanne Hank takes it upon himself to find her a new boyfriend, but for his own personal gain.

title: Hank's Unmentionable Problem
description: Hank is very embarrassed and introvert about his constipation. And it certainly doesn't help his condition with Peggy telling all her friends, making Hank go to a proctologist and treating him like a child over it.

title: Westie Side Story
description: Hank and the rest of the gang on Rainey St. gets a culture shock when their new Laotian neighbors move in next door.

title: Shins of the Father
description: Hank's rambunctious, bigoted, sexist, loud war-vet father, Cotton, visits the Hills for Bobby's birthday. Instantly Cotton teaches the boy bad habits about how to treat women. Hank refuses to admit his father is doing wrong, until Cotton takes Bobby to the sleazy Hotel Arlen to go hooker shopping!

title: Peggy the Boggle Champ
description: Peggy and Hank head to Dallas so Peggy can compete in a boggle tournament, but Hank decides to forego the tournament in order to attend a lawnmower expo.

title: Keeping Up with Our Joneses
description: When Bobby is caught trying a cigarette, Hank decides the proper discipline is making Bobby smoke an entire carton. The result sparks an old smoking habit of Hank's and Peggy's, as well as a new habit in Bobby.

title: King of the Ant Hill
description: After Hank fires him as his exterminator, Dale infests Hanks lawn with ants in order to seek revenge.

title: Plastic White Female
description: Joeseph is throwing a co-ed party and informs Bobby there is going to be kissing. Never haven kissed a girl, Bobby practices on a plastic head Luanne was given for beauty school.

title: How to Fire a Rifle Without Really Trying
description: When Bobby discovers the one sport he is good at, marksmanship, he and Hank decide to enter a father & son tournament. As it turns out Hank is a terrible marksman.

title: Texas City Twister
description: Luanne moves back into her home, a trailer, just as a twister is about to hit.

title: Arrow Head
description: After Hank finds an arrow head in his lawn, Peggy gives a archaeologist permission to have an archaeological dig their yard.

title: Hilloween
description: Hank is excited about Halloween until a woman complains has the holiday canceled.

title: Jumpin' Crack Bass
description: While on a fishing trip, for the first time ever the guys catch more fish than Hank. In order to regain his title Hank seeks advice from a friend to whom tells him visit his friend who sells bait on the side of the road. Hank unwittingly goes to a different person to whom happens to be a cocaine pusher. As it turns out the fish are very taken to the cocaine, so continues to buy the narcotics all the while not realizing he's buying drugs and not bait. After he and Dale are caught in the middle of a "transaction", the police show up arrest the two of them. So now in order to stay out of prison must catch a fish using cocaine.

title: Husky Bobby
description: Much to Hank's dismay, Bobby becomes a plus sized model.

title: The Man Who Shot Cane Skretteburg
description: Hank and the guys seek vengeance after a group of teenagers beat them at paint-ball.

title: The Son That Got Away
description: Bobby and Connie get in trouble at school. They skirt their ensuing punishment and are joined by Joseph, as they head to "The Caves". Hank and Kahn quickly pursue them, knowing that the caves are Arlen's make-out point.

title: The Company Man
description: Hank goes out of his way to impress a potential out-of-town client, Mr. Holloway, to whom wants Hank to take him on an authentic tour of Texas. Unfortunately, Mr. Holloway doesn't know Texas beyond old cowboy films. Thus Hank is out of his comfort zone and make up various lies and excuses as to why he does not fit Mr. Holloway's stereotypical impression of an authentic Texan. And just when Hank is in the process of possibly finally closing the deal M.F. Thatherton swoops in and begins to impress Mr. Holloway with is ten gallon hat, boots, and his belt buckle.

title: Bobby Slam
description: Bobby joins the wrestling team and is caught in a dilemma when he has to fight Connie in order to make the team.

title: The Unbearable Blindness of Laying
description: Hank's mother bring home her new boyfriend, an affectionate Jewish man named Gary. After Hank sees the two of them having relations, he goes blind.

title: Meet the Manger Babies
description: With puppets she bought at a garage sale, Luanne creates a Christian puppet show called The Manger Babies. At her first public performance Luanne breaks down and Hank comes to the rescue. So Luannes thanks him by giving him a role in her next show. Unfortunately her show happens to be the same day as the Super Bowl. So Hank must choose between the two.

title: Snow Job
description: Hank calls into question his loyalty to Propane and the direction of his life after he finds out Buck Strickland owns an electric range.

title: I Remember Mono
description: While working part-time at she and Hank's old high school, Peggy learns that Hank had mono (the kissing disease). But Peggy has never had mono so that could mean Hank got it from another woman. After Peggy stops speaking to him Hank jumps through hoops to impress her.

title: Three Days of the Kahndo
description: Hank, Dale and Kahn are stuck in Mexico after Kahn cheats a condo owner out of money. As a result, the Arlenians have to sneak across the Rio Grande back into Texas.

title: Traffic Jam
description: Hank, accompanied by Bobby, has to attend defensive driving classes taught by comedic instructor Boudda Sac (Chris Rock). Bobby, inspired by Sac's racially charged humor, decides to do his own "White Pride" routine.

title: Hank's Dirty Laundry
description: Hank fights to clear his good name after mistakenly being charged for not returning a dirty movie to the local video store.

title: The Final Shinsult
description: Cotton and Dale plot to steal the wooden leg of historical Mexican General Santa Anna while it is on display in the Arlen museum.

title: Leanne's Saga
description: Luanne's mother, Leanne, is released from prison and takes up residence with the Hill family. Trouble begins to brew, however, when she starts dating Bill and falls into some old habits.

title: Junkie Business
description: Hank, in his fervor to pass up a sexy, female candidate for a position at Strickland Propane, inadvertently hires drug addict Leon Petard. Morale hits an all-time low at the job place when a "stick-boy" lawyer says that Hank must accommodate for Petard's condition.

title: Life in the Fast Lane, Bobby's Saga
description: In order to make Bobby learn the importance of hard work, Hank gets Bobby a job at the local race track as a drink-boy, under the management of an incompetent boss. Bobby desperately tries to convince his father that his boss is an idiot, Hank is convinced Bobby simply is isn't applying himself enough and makes him continue working for the man. Descision and an oversight, on Hank's part, that may put Bobby's life in dire jeopardy.

title: Peggy's Turtle Song
description: Bobby is diagnosed with ADD, which causes Peggy to quit her job and keep an eye on him. Peggy begins to question her role in life when she starts taking guitar lessons from a feminist musician.

title: Propane Boom
description: Buck Strickland is forced to close the Arlen branch of Strickland Propane after the local Mega Lo Mart begins selling propane at a lower price. As a result, Hank has to take a job at Mega Lo- working under Buckley.

title: Death of a Propane Salesman
description: Buckley is killed in an explosion at Mega Lo Mart.

title: And They Call It Bobby Love
description: When Bobby begins dating Marie, an older girl, Hank and Peggy oppose the relationship for different reasons. Peggy believes he is too young to have a girlfriend. Hank, while somewhat proud of his son, becomes concerned with some of Marie's traits, particularly her vegetarianism. Meanwhile, a couch mysteriously appears in the alley. The guys try to get it hauled away-- until they discover how much fun they can have sitting on it.

title: Peggy's Headache
description: Stressed by her new job as a newspaper columnist, Peggy seeks John Redcorn's help. Hank fears she's getting the same kind of "help" as Nancy, which leads to an eye-opening experience for Peggy.

title: Pregnant Paws
description: Hank's desperation attempts of getting his dog pregnant aggravate Peggy. Peggy becomes especially upset when Hank discovers Ladybird has narrow uterus and Hank decides the next best option would be in vitro fertilization. This revelation upsets Peggy because Hank didn't this hard when they were attempting to have children and when the idea in vitro fertilization came up Hank shot it down. Over time they realize that Hank's male biological clock is ticking and these attempts to get his dog pregnant is Hank unconsciously fulfilling his desire to have more children.

title: Next of Shin
description: Deedee has become pregnant with Cotton's child.

title: Peggy's Pageant Fever
description: Peggy competes in a pageant exclusively for mothers in an attempt to win a truck of her own.

title: Nine Pretty Darn Angry Men
description: On Black Friday, the day following Thanksgiving, the Hill's head to the mall. Peggy is planning to spend her day shopping for what is in "her" opinion is the busiest shopping day of the holiday season, while Hank, Boomhauer, Dale, and Bill are participants in a lawnmower focus group. Much to Hank's dismay his father receives word of this event and decides to attend. If that's not enough, Hank is under the impression they're at the focus group to discuss their current line of mowers (i.e. Hank's mower). But he soon discovers that they're attending to discuss a new line of mowers. While all of the other attendees revel at the new mower, Hank goes out of his way to convince the others that this new mower isn't as good as the original just because it's new. But little do they all know, Hank's persistence has less to do with the mower and more to do with his mother...

title: Good Hill Hunting
description: Bobby is excited about going on his first deer hunting trip, but Hank fails to obtain the proper license in time and must seek an alternative.

title: Pretty, Pretty Dresses
description: During the Christmas season, Bill becomes suicidal and his friends have to watch him. Things take a bizarre turn when he decides to become his ex-wife Lenore.

title: A Fire-fighting We Will Go
description: Hank, Dale, Boomhauer, and Bill become volunteer firefighters. After one of them accidentally burns down the firehouse the each have different interpretations of how it happened.

title: To Spank with Love
description: Peggy gets a reputation for draconian discipline after spanking one of her students in class.

title: Three Coaches and a Bobby
description: Hank and the guys get the idea of having their former high school football, Coach Sauers, coach take over Bobby's recreational football team. It appears the years have taken their toll as Sauers' coaching methods are cruel and unusual. Thus, resulting in many of the players quitting and simultaneously begin playing for the near by soccer team 'The Wind'. Much to the disappointment of Hank, Bobby soon follows.

title: De-Kahnstructing Henry
description: Hank inadvertently causes Kahn to lose his job.

title: The Wedding of Bobby Hill
description: Both Luanne and Bobby are enticed by the charm of "self-proclaimed" genius Rad Thibodeaux, much to the dismay of Hank. After an incident at Boomhauer's house, where Bobby was supposed to be house-sitting, Luanne and Rad break-up. Upset with Luanne over the recent revelation he begins to perform a series of practical jokes which she retaliates to. For Bobby's final joke he replaces Luanne's birth control pills with candy. With the assistance of Hank and Peggy, Luanne convinces Bobby that because she didn't take her birth control pills she is now pregnant and Bobby must marry her.

title: Sleight of Hank
description: Hank is upset when Peggy refuses to reveal the details of a magic trick to him.

title: Jon Vitti Presents: 'Return to La Grunta'
description: While Luanne gets a job at a country club, Hank has an unpleasant encounter with a dolphin.

title: Escape from Party Island
description: Hanks accompanies his mother and some of her friends on a trip to a museum on an island during Spring Break, the only problem is MTV and the college students are there, too.

title: Love Hurts and So Does Art
description: While Bobby comes down with a case of gout when he becomes addicted to deli food, Hank is horrified to find an X-ray of his colon in an art museum.

title: Hank's Cowboy Movie
description: Hank and his friends make a video to persuade the Dallas Cowboys to relocate their training camp to Arlen.

title: Dog Dale Afternoon
description: After Dale remorselessly damages Hank's mower, for what ever reason filling the gas tank with a substance her refers to as "aqua-hol", Dale further infuriates his neighbor buy purchasing an expensive new mower and instantly becomes to envy of everyone in the alley. With the assistance of Boomhauer, Bill, and Peggy, Hank hides Dale's mower and sends him a series of cryptic notes and photographs which drive further in to insanity and obsession. While do some exterminating atop a balcony, a concerned Bill thinks Dale is sniper and calls the police. With police sharp shooters and gun toting vigilantes all armed and ready to take out Dale, it's up to Hank to save the day and the life of his friend.

title: Revenge of the Lutefisk
description: Cotton is suspected of arson when the church burns down; the police believe that he did it because of the new woman pastor.

title: Death and Texas
description: Hank is outraged when Peggy agrees to meet an inmate on Death Row who claims to be one of her former pupils. He's no happier when Peggy discovers the inmate is an impostor, who's just using her as an unknowing "mule" to smuggle cocaine past the guards. Meanwhile, Dale offers to spray the prison for a pittance in order to get on the waiting list to become an executioner.

title: Wings of the Dope
description: Luanne believes that the angel of her late boyfriend Buckley has visited her.

title: Take Me Out of the Ball Game
description: Hank is chosen to coach Strickland Propane's softball team and invites Peggy to play pitcher, which spurs friction between the two when Peggy becomes the star player.

title: As Old as the Hills
description: Feeling depressed and inadequate due to their routine lives and the impending birth of Hank's brother, Hank & Peggy decide to celebrate their 20th anniversary by going sky diving. But things go awry when Peggy's parachute fails to open and Didi goes into labor with no one to drive her to the hospital but Bobby.

title: Peggy Hill: The Decline and Fall
description: Peggy survives the fall with several broken bones and paralysis, while Cotton names his newborn son G.H., which stands for "Good Hank."

title: Cotton's Plot
description: Cotton helps Peggy rehabilitate, while Peggy uncovers the truth behind Cotton's war stories.

title: Bills Are Made to Be Broken
description: When Bill's high school football record is broken unfairly, Hank convinces him to return to the field and re-claim his record.

title: Little Horrors of Shop
description: Hank becomes the new temporary shop teacher at Bobby's school where he gives the students a whole new outlook on tools and woodworking.

title: Aisle 8A
description: Hank has the misfortune of being left all alone with Connie right when she gets her first period. He tries to handle the situation the best way he knows how, and unfortunately, he doesn't.

title: A Beer Can Named Desire
description: Hank is given the chance to win a million dollars after winning an Alamo Beer contest. All he must do is throw a football through a one-foot hole into a Giant Alamo beer can. Or he can let former Cowboy "Dandy" Don Meredith make the throw for $100,000; Bill visits his family in Louisiana.

title: Happy Hank's Giving
description: The Hills and their friends are all stranded at the Dallas-Fort Worth airport the night before Thanksgiving.

title: Not in My Back Hoe
description: Hank strikes up a friendship with a man just like himself, straining his relationship with Dale, Bill and Boomhauer; Cotton puts up his own child as collateral so he can test drive a new car.

title: To Kill a Ladybird
description: Bobby befriends a wild raccoon that may or may not have infected Ladybird and Dale with rabies.

title: Hillennium
description: As Y2K approaches, everybody fears the approaching millennium, even Dale, who hoards food, Mountain Dew and hamsters in his basement. Only Hank is unaffected by the growing concerns...until there's a propane shortage.

title: Old Glory
description: Peggy authors one of Bobby's English papers, only to have a rival substitute teacher uncover the deception; Bill displays an enormous American flag on his property.

title: Rodeo Days
description: Bobby secretly becomes a rodeo clown.

title: Hanky Panky: Part 1
description: Buck Strickland is getting a divorce. Since Texas is a community property state, he sells Sugarfoot's Barbecue to Hank until the divorce is final.

title: High Anxiety: Part 2
description: When Debbie, Buck's former girl Friday and lover, turns up dead in a dumpster, a city detective suspects Hank of murdering her.

title: Naked Ambition
description: During a picnic, Bobby accidentally sees Luanne naked, and Joseph is jealous of him.

title: Movin' on Up
description: Luanne is sick of Hank's rules and regulations, so she rents the house next door with three other people. When she gets angry at them for being irresponsible, she gets upset because she's acting just like Hank would.

title: Bill of Sales
description: Peggy starts selling health bars, but when her business is slow, she uses Bill to do all the work and takes most of the money.

title: Won't You Pimai Neighbor?
description: Buddhist monks believe Bobby is a lama.

title: Hank's Bad Hair Day
description: After Hank's usual barber loses his mind he dyes Hank's hair blonde, so Bill convinces Hank to let him cut his hair and re-dye his hair it's natural color. Not long after that Hank receives a letter from the government stating that the haircut will cost him $900.00.

title: Meet the Propaniacs
description: Bobby forms a comedy group called The Propaniacs, who goes around to several Strickland Propane locations with their propane-centered skits.

title: Nancy Boys
description: Nancy ends her 14-year-long affair with John Redcorn.

title: Flush with Power
description: Hank joins the town council to uncover the truth behind the recent requirement of ineffectual low-flow toilets.

title: Transnational Amusements Presents: Peggy's Magic Sex Feet
description: Peggy is ashamed of her size 16 feet, but her shame turns to pride when an alleged doctor takes an interest in filming them. She does not know, however, that the man is really photographing them for a sex fetish website.

title: Peggy's Fan Fair
description: The Hills go to a country music festival in Nashville, where no one believes Peggy when she says that Randy Travis plagiarized a song she submitted to him.

title: The Perils of Polling
description: Hank meets Presidential candidate George W. Bush at a rally and is unimpressed by his handshake, while Luanne registers to vote as a Communist.

title: The Buck Stops Here
description: Bobby works for Mr. Strickland as his golf caddy for the summer. Peggy and Minh race each other to see who can donate the most blood.

title: I Don't Want to Wait for Our Lives to Be Over, I Want to Know Right Now, Will It Be... Sorry. Do Do Doo Do Do, Do Do Doo Do Do, Do Do Doo Do Do, Doo...
description: Puberty hits 12 year-old Joseph before it hits 13 year-old Bobby. Hank builds coffins for himself and Peggy.

title: Spin the Choice
description: During the Thanksgiving season, John Redcorn tries to get closer to Joseph by teaching him about the plight of the Native Americans.

title: Peggy Makes the Big Leagues
description: Peggy substitutes in the geometry class at Arlen High, where she attracts the ire of local businessmen for giving a failing grade to a star football player.

title: When Cotton Comes Marching Home
description: Cotton loses his home and must go back to work to support Didi and G.H.

title: What Makes Bobby Run?
description: Bobby attempts to achieve yearbook immortality by becoming the school mascot.

title: 'Twas the Nut Before Christmas
description: Bill opens a Santa Claus village at his house and annoys Hank by keeping it open well after Christmas.

title: Chasing Bobby
description: Hank's truck is on its last wheels and he balks at the thought of getting a new truck, much to the chagrin of friends and family.

title: Yankee Hankee
description: Hank is a proud Texan, which is all about to change when Cotton reveals to him he was born in New York City.

title: Hank and the Great Glass Elevator
description: When Bill forms a friendship with Former Texas Governor Ann Richards, his ex-wife Lenore returns.

title: Now Who's the Dummy?
description: After performing at a retirement home with his class, Bobby receives a ventriloquist's dummy from one of the residents there. Hank begrudgingly warms up to the idea, but Dale is deathly afraid of it due to a traumatic childhood experience.

title: Ho, Yeah!
description: After a violent pimp shows up looking for her, Hank and Peggy unknowingly board a prostitute. Then they soon discover that Hank has been unwittingly "pimping" her all around town.

title: The Exterminator
description: Dale can no longer work as an exterminator because the chemicals he uses have eroded his sinuses. Thus, he must get an office job.

title: Luanne Virgin 2.0
description: Luanne joins a church group to become a "born-again virgin," where Peggy reveals a shocking fact about her past.

title: Hank's Choice
description: When Bobby develops an allergy to Ladybird's dander, Hank makes him live in the dog house he built for the dog who refuses to live in it.

title: It's Not Easy Being Green
description: Hank joins Bobby's science class in opposition to a plan to drain the quarry and put a landfill there, because it will reveal a practical joke which he, Dale, and Bill played on Boomhauer in high school.

title: The Trouble with Gribbles
description: When Channel 83 replaces Nancy with Luanne as the weather lady, Dale concocts a scheme to sue a tobacco company to pay for a face lift for his wife.

title: Hank's Back Story
description: Hank must wear a prosthesis when he is diagnosed with Diminished Gluteal Syndrome.

title: Kidney Boy and Hamster Girl: A Love Story
description: Bobby pretends to be a high schooler with a congenital kidney disease that has stunted his growth. He later adds to the charade by claiming Connie has a vestigial tail.

title: Bobby Goes Nuts
description: After being beat up by some bullies Hank advises Bobby to attend a boxing course at the YMCA. Once there Bobby discovers that they are full, so instead joins a womens self defense course where he is taught to kick people in the groin as a form of self defense

title: Soldier of Misfortune
description: When Dale is ridiculed by the Arlen Gun Club for accidentally misfiring a weapon, his friends must come up with a plan to help restore Dale's self-esteem.

title: Lupe's Revenge
description: Peggy accidentally brings a Mexican girl into the country after a Spanish class field trip to Mexico. When she tries to bring her back, she is arrested for kidnapping.

title: The Father, the Son and J.C.
description: Hank and Cotton clash during the Christmas season while working for Habitat for Humanity.

title: Father of the Bribe
description: Khan bribes Bobby to stay away from Connie.

title: I'm with Cupid
description: After spending some depressing time with Bill on Valentine's Day, Bobby starts to fear he'll end up alone. He turns his desperation towards Connie until Hank steps in and asks Boomhauer to teach Bobby how to 'pitch woo'.

title: Torch Song Hillogy
description: The Olympic torch is passing through Arlen on its way to Salt Lake City, so Peggy nominates Bobby to carry the torch. He loses to Hank, whom his friends nominated behind his back.

title: Joust Like a Woman
description: Peggy jeopardizes a potential deal for Hank by trying to bring Women's Liberation to the Arlen Renaissance Fair.

title: The Bluegrass Is Always Greener
description: Connie plays the fiddle in Hank's bluegrass band, but keeps it a secret from her father, who wants her to go to Van Cliburn's violin academy.

title: The Substitute Spanish Prisoner
description: Peggy is dubbed a "genius" after taking an on-line test from the Texas Institute of Intelligence, which leads her into a series of confidence schemes.

title: Unfortunate Son
description: Cotton and his army buddies have to stay at Hank's house when the VFW loses its lease.

title: Are You There God? It's Me, Margaret Hill
description: Peggy pretends to be a nun to get a job teaching Spanish at a Catholic school.

title: Tankin' It to the Streets
description: When Dale convinces Bill that the government used him as a guinea pig for an experimental drug with disastrous results, Bill steals a tank from the army base.

title: Of Mice and Little Green Men
description: When Dale realizes that he did not have sex with Nancy anywhere near the time Joseph was conceived, he becomes convinced that a space alien is his son's real father.

title: A Man Without a Country Club
description: Nine Rivers, Arlen's all-Asian country Club, is under pressure to have a non-Asian member, so Khan tries to get Hank to join.

title: Beer and Loathing
description: Peggy becomes a customer service representative for Alamo Beer, Hank's favorite brand. She is sworn to secrecy about the reason for the beer's sudden unavailability in the area.

title: Fun with Jane and Jane
description: Luanne gets accepted by a college sorority that is actually a cult, while Hank and his friend has to shoot emus for Buck Strickland.

title: My Own Private Rodeo
description: Hank discovers that Dale's long-lost father is a cowboy on the gay rodeo circuit.

title: Sug Night
description: Peggy is upset when she learns Hank has been having dreams about grilling hamburgers in the nude with Nancy.

title: Dang Ol' Love
description: Boomhauer plans to ask his girlfriend to marry him.

title: Returning Japanese
description: Cotton returns to Japan to learn that he has an illegitimate son.

title: Get Your Freak Off
description: After Hank catches Bobby freak dancing at a concert, he forbids his son from attending a boys-and-girls slumber party--but Bobby sneaks off on his own.

title: The Fat and the Furious
description: A cute groupie convinces Bill to enter a hot dog eating contest that pits him against a Laotian champion.

title: Bad Girls, Bad Girls Whatcha Gonna Do
description: Connie's delinquent cousin, Tid Pao, wreaks havoc while visiting Arlen.

title: Goodbye Normal Jeans
description: Peggy gets jealous of Bobby's home economic skills. Bill loses a million dollar bet to Dale.

title: Dances with Dogs
description: Bobby and Hank compete in a dog dancing contest.

title: The Son Also Roses
description: Bobby ditches his towel manager responsibilities on the football team to work on growing his roses.

title: The Texas Skilsaw Massacre
description: In this episode, Hank is sentenced to an anger management class after accidentally sawing off Dale's finger.

title: Full Metal Dust Jacket
description: Peggy opens her own bookstore, but when she discovers that customers are nonexistent, she reluctantly allows Dale to sublet space so he can sell guns.

title: Pigmalion
description: Luanne is wooed by millionaire Trip Larsen...who has bizarre plans for her.

title: Megalo Dale
description: Hank puts his reputation on the line when he recommends Dale for an exterminator job at Megalomart...only to realize that Dale thinks the vermin is Chuck Mangione; Bobby cheats at a game by stuffing beans up his nose.

title: Boxing Luanne
description: Luanne becomes a boxer.

title: Vision Quest
description: Hank takes Joseph on a vision quest in hopes of changing the boy's ways, but when Dale ends up experiencing a vision of his own, he misinterprets one of Joseph's dreams...and encourages him to kill a panda at the zoo.

title: Queasy Rider
description: After attending couples counseling, Hank and Peggy buy a motorcycle and head for Sturgis, South Dakota to attend a giant biker rally. But trouble erupts when Hank refuses to allow Peggy to do the driving.

title: Board Games
description: Tension erupts between Peggy, Minh and Nancy when a seat opens on the school board and each of the women announces their intention to run.

title: An Officer and a Gentle Boy
description: When Bobby repeatedly disobeys Hank, he is forced to attend the same boot camp Cotton went to in his youth. But to Cotton's horror, the once draconian facility now mollycoddles its cadets.

title: The Miseducation of Bobby Hill
description: When Hank teaches Bobby the basics of propane sales, Bobby ignores the advice and uses his own strategy--with impressive results; Bill sails away in a lawn chair tied to weather balloons; Peggy worries that the liver cleanser she bought is poisoning her.

title: The Good Buck
description: Hank and Peggy become concerned when the leering buck Strickland ends up in Luanne's Bible study class; Bobby skips gym class to have tea and scones at the posh Hotel Arlen.

title: I Never Promised You an Organic Garden
description: Peggy convinces Principal Moss to hire her as the new full-time organic gardening teacher by promising the vegetables to the football team. However, organic gardening proves much harder than it sounds.

title: Be True to Your Fool
description: Bill spreads lice to Hank, Dale, and Boomhauer. When Hanks gets his head shaved, he's surprised to discover he has a tattoo on his scalp.

title: Racist Dawg
description: Hank is accused of being a racist when Ladybird barks at a black repairman.

title: Night and Deity
description: Dale meets the woman of his dreams when the neighborhood becomes infested with pigeons; Hank serves as Luanne's designated driver on her birthday, only to end up getting drunk.

title: Maid in Arlen
description: Kahn reacts with horror when his mother becomes the Hills' maid... and Bill's lover.

title: Witches of East Arlen
description: Hank is horrified when Bobby joins a group of "witches" who want the boy to drink dog's blood during one of their ceremonies.

title: Patch Boomhauer
description: Boomhauer's brother Patch comes into town driving a Saab 900NG cabriolet to marry Boomhauer's ex-girlfriend, Katherine. Patch is busy making arrangements for the wedding and Boomhauer is sulking, as he still loves Katherine. At a party at Hank's house, Patch asks Boomhauer to be his best man.

title: Reborn to Be Wild
description: Hank reacts with horror when Bobby's Bible study group turns out to be populated with Christian skate punks who wear tattoos and dress like rockers; Dale and his friends form a Last Supper club.

title: New Cowboy on the Block
description: A washed-up football star moves into the neighborhood.

title: The Incredible Hank
description: Peggy suspects that Hank suffers from Irritable Male Syndrome and begins spiking his coffee with testosterone, turning Hank from low-energy everyman to muscled go-getter.

title: Flirting with the Master
description: A dashing mexican television star asks Peggy to spend two weeks south of the border to tutor his children, but Peggy gets the feeling that the actor wants to have an affair with her.

title: After the Mold Rush
description: Hank enters his house in Arlen's parade of homes showcase, but when the hill house tests positive for mold, Hank and his family must relocate to a seedy hotel.

title: Livin' on Reds, Vitamin C and Propane
description: Hank lives up to his boyhood dream of driving a big rig when helping his mother to move. Bobby tags along and, unfortunately, so do Dale, Bill and Boomhauer; Meanwhile Peggy and Luanne write a very poor Christmas carol.

title: Rich Hank, Poor Hank
description: When Bobby mistakenly believes that his parents are rich, he steals Hank's credit card and goes on a shopping spree.

title: Ceci N'est Pas Une King of the Hill
description: Hank commissions Peggy to create some artwork to satisfy the local zoning board after they approve a Strickland Propane expansion, but Peggy is humiliated when an art dealer promotes her as an illiterate hillbilly.

title: That's What She Said
description: A new Strickland Propane employee revels in making off-color jokes, driving Hank crazy.

title: My Hair Lady
description: Bill pretends to be a homosexual to get a job at a trendy beauty salon.

title: Phish and Wildlife
description: Hank and his friends take Bobby on an "eat only what you catch" camping trip, only to discover that the park has been overrun by hippies.

title: Cheer Factor
description: Peggy takes over as coach of the cheerleading squad, and switches the girls from elaborate dance routines to violent spectacle.

title: Dale Be Not Proud
description: When racecar driver John Force needs a kidney transplant, Dale turns out to be a perfect match; and Peggy helps Bobby win over his classmates when he reads announcements over the school's intercom system.

title: Aprs Hank, le Deluge
description: Arlen is hit with rains and flash floods. Bill finds himself put in charge of the shelter at Tom Landry Middle School, and instantly becomes mad with power and authority.

title: DaleTech
description: Cotton plays detective when someone begins drinking Hank's grapefruit juice; and Dale tries to launch his own home security company.

title: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Alamo
description: Hank reacts with disbelief when he realizes Bobby's history textbook contains almost nothing on the Alamo; and Peggy photographs a Flat Stanley doll to help teach kids about geography and safety issues.

title: Girl, You'll Be a Giant Soon
description: Luanne joins forces with Hank to protest a propane ban at the Texas State Fairground grill-off; and Peggy goes to extreme lengths to gain access to a laundry room where an infamous murder took place.

title: Stressed for Success
description: Bobby joins the school's academic team, where he specializes in pop culture, but the stress proves too much for him to handle.

title: Hank's Back
description: Hank starts taking yoga classes after injuring his back at work; and Peggy bags groceries at a mom-and-pop store that's having a hard time competing against Megalomart.

title: The Redneck on Rainey Street
description: After Connie becomes a victim of reverse discrimination, Kahn gives up his hopes and dreams and embraces the life of a hillbilly.

title: Talking Shop
description: Bobby infuriates Hank by training as a student counsellor, then upsets Connie by breaking the rules and dating one of his own clients - only to be stalked by a girl he's just advised to break up with her boyfriend.

title: A Rover Runs Through It
description: The Hills travel to Montana where Peggy attempts to make amends with her estranged rancher mother; Meanwhile, Hank clashes with the locals and Henry Winkler.

title: Ms Wakefield
description: During the Christmas season, a dying, elderly woman wants to spend her final days in the Hills' house, which used to be hers.

title: Death Buys a Timeshare
description: Hank accompanies Cotton and Bill to Mexico to keep them from buying into a timeshare; and Peggy, Dale, and Bobby sneak into swimming pools during a heat wave.

title: Yard, She Blows!
description: Peggy tries to spruce up the front yard by purchasing a lawn gnome, much to Hank's horror.

title: Dale to the Chief
description: Hank is embarrassed when his new driver's license lists him as female; and after reviewing the warren commission report, Dale turns pro-America.

title: The Petriot Act
description: Hank wants to help out the boys fighting overseas by looking after one of their pets. Bill is currently looking after a GI's dog, and Hank wants to do the same. Unfortunately, instead of a dog, he gets a untamed, fierce cat named Duke, with large claws, large teeth, and large vet bills.

title: Enrique-cilable Differences
description: Enrique's marriage is in limbo, but rather than face up to his problems, he tries to find someone else to turn to. He chooses to confide in a heartless Hank who casts him out.

title: Mutual of Omabwah
description: Hank realizes he doesn't have any home-owner's insurance; Dale realizes people are willing to pay money to be stung by bees; Bill and Boomhauer discover the pleasures of a deep fryer; and Peggy and Luanne get stuck at a highway rest stop.

title: Care-Takin' Care of Business
description: Hank and his friends tend to the grass on a football field to keep the groundskeeper from being fired; and Luanne falls for lucky's new rims.

title: Arlen City Bomber
description: When Luanne runs up a large credit-card debt, Peggy vows to help her pay it off... but ends up buying a roller-derby team in the process.

title: Redcorn Gambles with His Future
description: John Redcorn opens a gambling casino on his land.

title: Smoking and the Bandit
description: Dale poses as The Smoking Bandit, a masked marauder who goes around to several Arlen businesses violating their anti-smoking regulations.

title: Gone with the Windstorm
description: When the station manager hires a new weatherman to replace Nancy after she blows an important forecast, Peggy convinces Nancy that covering a dangerous wildfire is the only way to win back her job.

title: Bobby on Track
description: A track coach uses Bobby to shame good athletes when they get out of line.

title: It Ain't Over 'Til the Fat Neighbor Sings
description: Bill believes he has found acceptance when he joins a glee club.

title: Hank's on Board
description: Hank prevails on Dale and Boomhauer to invite Bill and himself on their annual fishing trip.

title: Bystand Me
description: Peggy gets a job at the town newspaper writing a household tips column, but inadvertently gives readers the recipe for mustard gas.

title: Bill's House
description: When Bill goes to volunteer at a halfway house, he winds up housing a group of recovering alcoholics at his own home.

title: Harlottown
description: Hank is devastated when Peggy uncovers some unsavory facts about the founding of the town of Arlen.

title: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Clown
description: Bobby impresses no one but his teacher when he learns Commedia Dell'Arte.

title: Orange You Sad I Did Say Banana?
description: Ted Wasanasong calls Khan a "banana" - a derogatory term for an Asian who is "yellow on the outside, white on the inside" - making him think he has lost touch with his Laotian heritage.

title: You Gotta Believe (In Moderation)
description: Hank's league champion softball team challenges an undefeated comedic barnstorming team.

title: Business Is Picking Up
description: Bobby participates in a "job shadow" program, where he's wowed by an entrepreneur who makes a living picking up after dogs.

title: The Year of Washing Dangerously
description: Strickland partners with Kahn in a car wash business, forcing Hank to become Kahn's "work monkey."

title: Hank Fixes Everything
description: Strickland embarks on a propane price war, so he hires the Teutuls from "American Chopper" to spark sales at the Propane Expo. But the Teutuls only manage to start a riot.

title: Church Hopping
description: After having a falling out with Reverend Stroup, Hank leaves Arlen First Methodist and joins a Mega-Church... only to be overwhelmed by its nonstop demands on his free time.

title: 24 Hour Propane People
description: After swearing off his favorite strip club, Strickland refashions the propane business using an ice-cream parlor as his inspiration; and Peggy uses her press credentials to obtain free things.

title: The Texas Panhandler
description: When Hank rejects Bobby's request for expensive designer jeans, Bobby takes his dad's advice and gets himself a really "cool" job; but begging on the street isn't exactly what Hank had in mind.

title: Hank's Bully
description: Hank's new neighbors' son won't stop harassing him, and his parents refuse to do anything about it. So he takes matters into his own hands, which gets him in trouble with the police.

title: Edu-macating Lucky
description: Lucky, Luanne's good-for-nothing boyfriend, won't marry her until he passes his ged test; when he asks Peggy to tutor him, she schemes to end their relationship by teaching him all the wrong answers.

title: The Peggy Horror Picture Show
description: Peggy becomes friends with a local drag queen. But Peggy doesn't know that her friend's really a man, and her friend doesn't realize that Peggy's a real woman.

title: Serpunt
description: The Hills create a snake scare when a large python is released into the sewer system, and a couple of greedy city contractors try to take advantage of the situation.

title: Blood and Sauce
description: Bill discovers that he and his cousin are the end of the Dautrieve family line, so he tries to find a way to preserve his family legacy.

title: Luanne Gets Lucky
description: Luanne goes to prom with a fifteen-year-old boy because she missed her own prom, and she wants to make Lucky pay attention to her.

title: Hank Gets Dusted
description: Hank's cousin, ZZ Top's Dusty Hill, comes to Arlen and makes Hank the butt of all his jokes for his new reality television program.

title: Glen Peggy Glen Ross
description: Peggy becomes a Realtor. Hank gets a new set of golf clubs with a disturbing past.

title: The Passion of the Dauterive
description: Bill becomes involved with the female pastor at his church, much to the horror of Hank and his fellow parishioners.

title: Grand Theft Arlen
description: Hank becomes obsessed with a video game based on his own life. Bobby attempts to improve his physical condition.

title: Peggy's Gone to Pots
description: Peggy gets fooled into selling kitchen supplies. The real Rusty Shackleford confronts Dale.

title: Hair Today, Gone Today
description: Dale believes that he has traveled back in time. Stress over a past relationship causes Nancy to suffer hair loss.

title: Bill, Bulk and the Body Buddies
description: Bill unwisely allows some crazed muscle-bound male bodybuilders to use the neighborhood's exercise equipment if in exchange they help him get in shape.

title: Lucky's Wedding Suit
description: In order to pay for the big expensive wedding of her dreams, Luanne's husband-to-be Lucky sues Dale in hopes of getting a big cash settlement, like what he's received in past lawsuits, when he accidentally injures himself shortly after going to work for Dale's extermination service "Dale's Dead Bug".

title: Suite Smells of Excess
description: Hank and the guys take Bobby to to a Texas/Nebraska college football game. During the game, they help themselves to an empty luxury suite, which puts them in a precarious situation at the end of the ball game.

title: Bobby Rae
description: Bobby protests against commercialism at Tom Landry Middle School when he discovers that a cute girl is suddenly interested in him because of it.

title: The Powder Puff Boys
description: Bobby is selected to be a powder-puff cheerleader, but Peggy and the rest the PTA threaten to disband the group after the PTA president decides that it's sexist.

title: Four Wave Intersection
description: Bobby, Joseph, and Connie are harassed at a water park by a group of bullies, and only Boomhauer can save them. Meanwhile, Bill becomes a minor local celebrity after he starts waving at drivers from the side of the road.

title: Death Picks Cotton
description: Cotton is dying, but both he and Hank are having trouble coming to terms with it--and each other.

title: Raise the Steaks
description: Hank joins a co-op store because the steaks they sell are the best in town. However, he is forced to take extreme measures to get organic steaks when Mega-Lo-Mart buys out the store.

title: Tears of an Inflatable Clown
description: Bobby is in charge of putting together a carnival at Tom Landry Middle School, but a school-appointed diversity counselor takes all of the fun out of it.

title: The Minh Who Knew Too Much
description: Minh joins Dale's gun club to learn how to shoot skeet. Hank investigates who is putting their garbage in his garbage can.

title: Dream Weaver
description: Hank reluctantly joins Dale on a "vocation vacation," where Dale will learn basket weaving. However, problems arise when Dale is completely incompetent and Hank becomes the teacher's pet.

title: Doggone Crazy
description: Ladybird begins acting erratically during thunderstorms, and Hank must resort to consulting a "dog spiritualist" or risk losing her to Animal Control.

title: Trans-Fascism
description: Hank helps Buck Strickland and Sugarfoot's find a way to get around the Arlen City Council's new ban on trans fats.

title: Untitled Blake McCormick Project
description: Dale discovers that the daughter of one of Bill's lady-friends shares the same DNA as Joseph. He comes to the conclusion that he is the father of both of them.

title: The Accidental Terrorist
description: Hank seeks revenge when he finds out that his car salesman has been taking advantage of him for 20 years, but he gets in trouble when his plan gets out of hand.

title: Lady and Gentrification
description: While Hank helps out with Enrique's daughter's Quinceanera celebration, Peggy threatens to run Enrique's family out of its neighborhood by introducing it to the Arlen artistic community.

title: Behind Closed Doors
description: Peggy makes drastic changes around the home after a pop family therapist has her convinced that their family is having intimacy problems, which only pushes Hank and Bobby further away from her.

title: Pour Some Sugar on Kahn
description: Kahn uses karaoke to boost his self confidence and to help cope with his domineering father-in-law's latest visit.

title: Six Characters in Search of a House
description: Peggy hires actors and writes a script to help her open house for a home she can't sell. But instead of selling the house in question, she gets carried away and winds up selling her own house during the dress rehearsal.

title: The Courtship of Joseph's Father
description: A private academy bribes Dale into enrolling Joseph to play quarterback, but he soon learns that his family doesn't fit in because they're not rich.

title: Strangeness on a Train
description: When Peggy's birthday celebrations promise to disappoint her once again, she decides to plan her own party aboard a train that features a murder-mystery play.

title: Cops and Robert
description: Hank accidentally drives a mild-mannered man over the edge when he takes the man's wallet from him, incorrectly assuming that the man had just stolen his.

title: It Came from the Garage
description: Bobby temporarily becomes man of the house and Hank becomes the laughing stock of the neighborhood when everybody discovers that he's afraid of bats.

title: Life: A Loser's Manual
description: Peggy's jailbird brother (Luanne's father) comes to town, and commits another crime; and Lucky feels sorry for him, so he takes the blame.

title: Dia-BILL-ic Shock
description: Bill begins acting like a paraplegic after his doctor diagnoses him with diabetes and tells him to get a wheelchair.

title: Earthy Girls are Easy
description: Buck is looking for an easy way for Strickland Propane to go "green," and Dale is ready to take advantage of him and the situation.

title: Square-Footed Monster
description: Ted Wassonasong buys a house in Hank's neighborhood, tears it down, and builds a cheaply-made "McMansion" in its place.

title: Lost in MySpace
description: Hank runs into trouble with a temperamental co-worker who is promoted to co-assistant manager after Strickland Propane puts up its own MySpace page.

title: No Bobby Left Behind
description: Tom Landry Middle School labels Bobby and some of his other lazy classmates as "special needs" students so that they don't have to take and fail the standardized test and lower the school's numbers.

title: A Bill Full of Dollars
description: By observing Bill as an average consumer, Peggy, Dale, and Minh make a fortune in the stock market. But when Bill learns that he is being watched, the gravy train comes to an abrupt halt.

title: Straight as an Arrow
description: Hank butts heads with Wesley Cherish, a newcomer to Arlen, after the two jointly start a Scouting-type group called the Order of the Arrow. Hank believes that Wesley is being overly cautious with several of the group's activities and is upset when Bobby is deemed a bad influence for allowing his sons to play a violent video game. But Hank finds out that Wesley has a good reason for his conservative, cautious ways with his sons after the boys run off at a camp-in during Hank's shift ... and it comes at the expense of a promising friendship.

title: Lucky See, Monkey Do
description: As LuAnn prepares to have her baby, Peggy and Lucky's sister fight over how the baby should be delivered and raised. Meanwhile, Bill falls for the woman who greets him at the fast food drive-thru window.

title: What Happens at the National Propane Gas Convention in Memphis Stays at the National Propane Gas Convention in Memphis
description: Hank goes to the National Propane Gas Convention in Memphis to introduce Buck for an award, but he makes an ass of himself after Buck finds out that he has a illegitimate son in the propane business.

title: Master of Puppets
description: Bobby plays his guilt-ridden parents against each other after they forget to pick him up at the mall, but the move backfires when Hank and Peggy adopt a new strategy. Meanwhile, Dale tries to prove he can survive in the "wilderness."

title: Bwah My Nose
description: Hank breaks his nose practicing for a state championship flag football rematch. But when he gets it fixed by a plastic surgeon, it's so perfect that he doesn't want to play in the game and risk ruining it.

title: Uncool Customer
description: Peggy and Bobby try to impress a trendy mother and daughter that they meet in Bobby's cotillion class, while Hank finds a good new restaurant but hates the seating arrangements.

title: Nancy Does Dallas
description: Nancy gets a job as an anchor at a Dallas television station, but will Dale be able to survive in Arlen without her?

title: Born Again on the Fourth of July
description: While Hank and the guys take their 4th of July rivalry with Milton Street to dangerous levels, Bobby finds religion at Lucky's church.

title: Serves Me Right for Giving General George S. Patton the Bathroom Key
description: Hank finds out that he is executor of Cotton's will, which includes flushing his ashes down general Patton's toilet. Meanwhile, Dale and Bill go through a nasty "dudevorce"

title: Bad News Bill
description: Hank is ostracized for his lack of positive support for Bobby in the South Arlen youth baseball league.

title: Manger Baby Einstein
description: John Redcorn helps LuAnn produce a series of Manger Babies DVDs, but she learns the hard way that success in the children's entertainment industry is fleeting.

title: Uh-Oh Canada
description: Everybody on Rainey Street is put off by the Canadian family that moves into Boomhauer's house for the summer.

title: The Boy Can't Help It
description: When Bobby is befriended by a trio of older girls, Hank worries his son is being emasculated; and Hank and the guys build the ultimate homeless cart for a local bum.

title: To Sirloin with Love
description: Bobby becomes a steak critic.

title: The Honeymooners
description: Hank is shocked when his mother announces she is marrying a man she has only known for a few weeks. Soon after, the newlyweds celebrate by purchasing an RV and heading to Hank's.

title: Bill Gathers Moss
description: To relieve his loneliness, Bill takes in some roommates. They include a former pin up girl. a Russian who deals in high-end fashion knockoffs and Principal Moss.

title: When Joseph Met Lori and Made Out with Her in the Janitor's Closet
description: Dale attempts to give Joseph the "sex talk" but fails to, and takes a test claiming he has "dementia" leading to him joining a mental home, but then realizes he has to get out before Joseph and Lori go "all the way".

title: Just Another Manic Kahn-Day
description: Minh and Connie go to Laos for vacation. Khan is alone at home, and Peggy makes Hank promise to check on him. Strickland wants a big promotion to sell grills and puts Hank in charge. Bobby and Joseph find an old Vaudeville comedy routine on vinyl.
